page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: HOUSING Most of the housing within our area is scattered and relates fairly closely to the farming layout, a large percentage of the dwellings are or have been farmhouses or tied agricultural cottages. Many of them have been built from sandstone quarried from very small quarries of which there are about twenty all disused. One row of houses has no service road to it, it appears to be built on the boundary of an old common. Within our part of the village there are fifty eight dwellings with a population of one hundred and forty seven. The majority of these houses are red brick built. There is a small council estate, the rest appear to be privately owned.
